intro: Hieracium tardiusculum, commonly known as the late dwarf hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and meadows, preferring well-drained soils. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer, and its leaves are usually hairy and lance-shaped. Hieracium tardiusculum is often found in temperate climates and is relatively hardy, though it can be invasive in some regions.
